intro: Metastelma calcaratum, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a flowering plant native to the rocky regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and its ability to thrive in harsh, arid environments. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically violet or purple in color, often arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water and reduce transpiration. Metastelma calcaratum is a member of the Orchidaceae family, which includes a wide variety of orchids with diverse morphological features.
